Toys"R"Us

UI Design, UX research

2017–2018

I started working on the Toys"R"Us redesign in mid-2017 as part of a collaboration with Dawson Andrews. At the time, Toys"R"Us were preparing to file for Chapter 11 bankruptcy and really needed to push their numbers in eCommerce.

The Problem

They were struggling in some key areas that we were taked to fix; mobile traffic was 70%+ and accounted for 50% of total revenue. However, a recent re-platforming to Oracle ATG saw the conversion rate struggling—mobile was not performing. This tied into the UX and performace of the platform, it was outdated, confusing to the user, and it lacked speed.

The work we did, although no longer live (for the time being), saw a 20% increase in overall sales, 30% increase in mobile conversation rates, and 15% overall revenue increase.

In the case study below I will be discussing the parts of the project I was directly involved in, as well as my process throughout.

Colours

The work we did, although no longer live (for the time being), saw a 20% increase in overall sales, 30% increase in mobile conversation rates, and 15% overall revenue increase.

A simple colour system to help inform the user.

Typography

The work we did, although no longer live (for the time being), saw a 20% increase in overall sales, 30% increase in mobile conversation rates, and 15% overall revenue increase.

Gotham Rounded was the chosen typeface for this project.
